title: Escobar Malware: An emerging threat to stealing credentials from your Phone. Indicators Of Compromise

sentences: a9d1561ed0d23a5473d68069337e2f8e7862f7b72b74251eb63ccc883ba9459f SHA256 Escobar APK
Infamous Aberebot android banking trojan has returned as Escobar with new features, including stealing Google Authenticator multi-factor authentication code.
Name: McAfee<crlf>Package: com.escobar.pablo<crlf>SHA256 Hash: a9d1561ed0d23a5473d68069337e2f8e7862f7b72b74251eb63ccc883ba9459f

The new feature in the latest Escobar version includes remote control of the infected Android devices using VNC, recording audio, and taking photos, while also expanding the set of targeted apps for credential theft. The main goal of this trojan is to steal bank account details, check available balances and perform unauthorized banking transactions.
22e943025f515a398b2f559c658a1a188d0d889f SHA1 Escobar APK

During the investigation by the Cyble team, security researchers came across twitter posts. In that researcher has mentioned a malware whose name and icon are similar to legitimate antivirus McAfee. The researcher also found that this malware is the latest variant of the popular banking Trojan, Aberebot. This new variant is capable of stealing 2FA Code.
d57e1c11f915b874ef5c86cedb25abda MD5 Escobar APK
titles: Escobar Malware: An emerging threat to stealing credentials from your Phone
Escobar Malware: An emerging threat to stealing credentials from your Phone. Indicators Of Compromise

sentences: The malware requests users for 25 different permissions, some of that permission is listed below.

Take Photo Capture images from the devices camera<crlf>Send SMS Send any SMS to a particular number<crlf>Send SMS to All Contacts Automatically send SMS to all the contact numbers saved in the device<crlf>Inject a web page Inject a malicious URL<crlf>Download File Let download media files from the victims device<crlf>Kill Bot Delete itself<crlf>Uninstall an app Uninstall an application

Disable Wi-Fi/Mobile data and remove SIM card as in some cases, the malware can re-enable the Mobile Data.<crlf>Remove the application in case a factory reset is not possible.<crlf>Perform a factory reset.

The owner of the malware is renting its beta version for $3000 per month for a max of five customers and also they are planning to raise its price to $5000. One can use its free version for free for three days.
Source code review -<crlf>The researcher has observed a defined launcher activity in the malicious apps manifest file, which loads the first screen of the app, as shown in the below figure

During the investigation by the Cyble team, security researchers came across twitter posts. In that researcher has mentioned a malware whose name and icon are similar to legitimate antivirus McAfee. The researcher also found that this malware is the latest variant of the popular banking Trojan, Aberebot. This new variant is capable of stealing 2FA Code.

titles: Escobar Malware: An emerging threat to stealing credentials from your Phone

sentences: d57e1c11f915b874ef5c86cedb25abda MD5 Escobar APK
22e943025f515a398b2f559c658a1a188d0d889f SHA1 Escobar APK
Infamous Aberebot android banking trojan has returned as Escobar with new features, including stealing Google Authenticator multi-factor authentication code.
Infamous Aberebot android banking trojan has returned as Escobar with new features, including stealing Google Authenticator multi-factor authentication code.

The new feature in the latest Escobar version includes remote control of the infected Android devices using VNC, recording audio, and taking photos, while also expanding the set of targeted apps for credential theft. The main goal of this trojan is to steal bank account details, check available balances and perform unauthorized banking transactions.

The new feature in the latest Escobar version includes remote control of the infected Android devices using VNC, recording audio, and taking photos, while also expanding the set of targeted apps for credential theft. The main goal of this trojan is to steal bank account details, check available balances and perform unauthorized banking transactions.

The owner of the malware is renting its beta version for $3000 per month for a max of five customers and also they are planning to raise its price to $5000. One can use its free version for free for three days.

Name: McAfee<crlf>Package: com.escobar.pablo<crlf>SHA256 Hash: a9d1561ed0d23a5473d68069337e2f8e7862f7b72b74251eb63ccc883ba9459f

READ_SMS Access and read SMS from the victims device.<crlf>RECEIVE_SMS Intercept SMS received on the victims device<crlf>READCALLLOG Give access Call details<crlf>READ_CONTACTS Give access phone contact.<crlf>READPHONESTATE Give access to phone state, including the current cellular network information, the phone number and the serial number of the phone, the status of any ongoing calls, and a list of any Phone Accounts registered on the device.<crlf>RECORD_AUDIO Give access the app to record audio with the microphone, which has the potential to be misused by attackers<crlf>ACCESSFINELOCATION Give access to the devices precise location to be detected by using the Global Positioning System (GPS).<crlf>SEND_SMS Give access to the application to send SMS messages.<crlf>CALL_PHONE Give access to an application to initiate a phone call without going through the Dialer user interface for the user to confirm the call.<crlf>WRITEEXTERNALSTORAGE Give access the app to write or delete files in the devices external storage<crlf>READEXTERNALSTORAGE Give access the app to read the contents of the devices external storage<crlf>WRITE_SMS Give access to the app to modify or delete SMS.

Download and install software only from official app stores like Google Play Store or the iOS App Store.<crlf>Use reputed anti-virus software.<crlf>Use strong passwords and enforce multi-factor authentication(2FA).<crlf>Enable biometric security features such as fingerprint or face recognition for unlocking the mobile device where possible.<crlf>Be wary of opening any links received via SMS or emails delivered to your phone.<crlf>Be careful while enabling any permissions.

Download and install software only from official app stores like Google Play Store or the iOS App Store.<crlf>Use reputed anti-virus software.<crlf>Use strong passwords and enforce multi-factor authentication(2FA).<crlf>Enable biometric security features such as fingerprint or face recognition for unlocking the mobile device where possible.<crlf>Be wary of opening any links received via SMS or emails delivered to your phone.<crlf>Be careful while enabling any permissions.
